data.title: University of Mississippi
data.meta_description: Tre Harris (9) WR - CAREER HIGHLIGHTS • 2023 All-SEC Second-Team (Athlon, College Football Network) • 2023 Biletnikoff Award Watch List • 2022 Biletnikoff Aw...
data.text:
CAREER HIGHLIGHTS • 2023 All-SEC Second-Team (Athlon, College Football Network)

• 2023 Biletnikoff Award Watch List

• 2022 Biletnikoff Award Watch List (LA Tech)

• 2022 All-Conference USA First Team (LA Tech)

• 2021 Honorable Mention All-Conference USA First Team (LA Tech)

2024 (SENIOR): Preseason All-SEC first-team (Media).

2023 (SENIOR*): All-SEC second-team (Athlon, College Football Network) ... Played in 12 games, started in 11 as Ole Miss' top receiver ... Led Ole Miss with 985 yards and eight touchdowns receiving, second on the team with 54 receptions ... Ended within the SEC top-10 in receiving touchdowns (fourth), yards per reception (fourth, 18.2), receiving yards (fifth), receiving yards per game (fifth, 82.1) and receptions per game (ninth, 4.5) ... Eight touchdown receptions ranks tied for sixth in Ole Miss single-season history, 985 yards ranks seventh ... One of five FBS receivers since 2021 with both a 200-yard receiving game and a four-touchdown receiving game within the same season ... PFF's sixth-best rated receiver nationally at 89.6 grade, third-best among SEC wideouts ... vs. Mercer (9/2/23): Opened Ole Miss career in spectacular fashion, ending with six receptions for 133 yards and a school record four receiving touchdowns ... Scored on each of his first three receptions as a Rebel ... One of 22 in SEC history with at least four receiving touchdowns in a game ... at #22 Tulane (9/9/23): Started and caught two passes for 55 yards and one touchdown, including a 31-yard reception for a score on Ole Miss’ first drive ... Left game during second drive due to injury ... at #12 Alabama (9/23/23): Targeted twice in five offensive snaps ... vs. #12 LSU (9/30/23): Started at wide reciever, tied career-high of eight receptions for an Ole Miss career-high 153 yards and one TD, the go-ahead score for the Rebels ... Also had an Ole Miss career-long 56-yard catch that led to a field goal .... vs. Arkansas (10/7/23): Started at wide receiever and caught one pass for 26 yards in 50 offensive snaps ... at Auburn (10/21/23): Started at wide reciever, caught four passes for 102 yards in 76 offensive and special teams snaps ... vs. Vanderbilt (10/28/23): Started and caught six passes for 67 yards in 63 snaps on offense ... vs. Texas A&M (11/4/23): Career day with career-high 11 receptions, 213 yards and one touchdown ... Sixth Rebel to ever have 200 yards receiving, ninth total game ... SEC Co-Offensive Player of the Week ... at #1 Georgia (11/11/23): Started at wide receiver, caught two passes for 12 yards ... vs. ULM (11/18/23): Recorded four catches for 63 yards and one TD ... at Mississippi State (11/23/23): Started at wideout, caught three passes for 27 yards ... vs. Penn State (12/30/23): Started at wide receiver, caught seven passes for 134 yards, the third-most yards in Ole Miss bowl history, in the Rebels’ Peach Bowl victory ... Reese's Senior Bowl Watch List ... Biletnikoff Award Watch List ... Transfer who arrived on campus in January and participated in spring drills.

LOUISIANA TECH: Appeared in 31 games for the Bulldogs, making 21 starts at wide receiver … Hauled in 1,529 receiving yards and 14 touchdowns during his time in Ruston … Earned first team All-Conference USA accolades in 2022 after leading Tech with 935 yards receiving and 10 touchdowns … Finished the 2022 season second on the team in receptions with 65 … Averaged 14.38 yards per catch and 77.92 yards per game … Registered at least three receptions in nine of the 12 games … Appeared in all 12 games, making nine starts at wide receiver during the 2021 season … Finished the year second on the team in receptions (40), receiving yards (562), and receiving touchdowns (4) … Appeared in seven games in 2020 season.

HIGH SCHOOL: Graduated from Comeaux HS … Played quarterback during prep career … Named Prep Football Player of the Week by the Lafayette Daily Adviser after going 11-for-11 with 262 passing yards and two touchdowns, while rushing for 119 yards and two TDs.

PERSONAL: Full name is Cleveland Joseph Harris III … Born on Feb. 28, 2002 … Son of Cleveland and Delana Harris Jr. … Graduated with a bachelor’s degree in general business in May 2024.
